title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.49-50 | 30-10-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: For the devotees, his factual form is disclosed, and for non-devotees, he appears like Kalarupa, which is causal form.
segments.summary: This segment explains the meaning of the verse, describing Krishna's descent as all-devouring time to eliminate the envious, contrasting the fates of devotees and asuras, and highlighting the protection afforded to devotees.

segments.key_quote: So for devotees, there is no death. That's why devotional service is the only way to conquer death.
segments.summary: This segment discusses how devotees are protected from death and how asuras fear death and deny the form of God to feel secure.

segments.key_quote: We have come out of our own choice, dictated by a strong desire to lord it over the resource of material world.
segments.summary: This segment explains the Pandavas' role in Krishna's mission to cleanse the earth of asuras, highlighting the asuras' envy of the Lord and devotees, and their desire to control the material world.

segments.key_quote: Everyone is trying to become an imitation god.
segments.summary: This segment describes the 'material disease' of wanting to be the lord, the competition among imitation gods (asuras), and how their disturbances lead devotees and demigods to pray for the Lord's intervention.

segments.key_quote: Lord Shri Krishna descended personally to vanquish Asuras like Kamsa, Jarasandha, Chishupala.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the periodic disturbances in the material world, the Lord's intervention to vanquish asuras, the annihilation of the Yadu dynasty, and Narada Muni's hint to the Pandavas about future events.
